So a penthouse they bought for $50M has a paper value of like $500k.

Anyone who thinks the wealthy actually gets shafted by tax increases and that the politicians they own won't leave loopholes open for them, not just in NYC but in pretty much every western country, are absolutely delusional.
Taxing the rich is just a convenient excuse politicians use to raise taxes with the peasants blessings.

item.title: I said LLMs are a non-intelligent mechanical confidence trick (con-man) and made a thread the other day saying the bubbl… — 5 replies — 10.3/hr
item.content:encoded:
I said LLMs are a non-intelligent mechanical confidence trick (con-man) and made a thread the other day saying the bubbl…

Open thread • Replies: 5 • Updated: 2026-02-18 09:28 UTC

OP

I said LLMs are a non-intelligent mechanical confidence trick (con-man) and made a thread the other day saying the bubble is already popping.

I realised I’ve made a huge mistake about AI. When I kept telling my imbecile manager that LLMs will never be more intelligent than us, I meant it’ll never be more intelligent than me. It’s already more intelligent than him. I forgot to put myself in his retarded shoes.

This realisation matters because it’s also the case for the majority of money swinging the stock market on a daily basis. Most people are retarded.

So I guess AI stocks surely have to double again until some semblance of financial reality finally has to set in. but right now we’ve got imbecile pajeet CEOs who spent their entire lives working on bullshit AI, who are determined to invest their entire company’s market cap into keeping the puppet show propped up for as long as possible for their own retarded ego.

Microsoft will do to OpenAI what MSTR is doing to bitcoin. Constant stock dilution, money borrowing way more than it can ever pay back, to invest in OpenAI. The show will almost never end until the global debt is in the sextrillions. The billions they've invested so far is fucking nothing. They'll go right to the wire, and the retard-controlled stock market will cheer them on.

And imbeciles will actively push microslop upwards ad-infinitum, believing that we're truly on the cusp of the singularity. Earnings don’t matter, the narrative is all that matters.

What a sick world we live in. Even Marx didn’t foresee capitalism becoming this chronically ill.

Early replies (first 3)

61869324
>>61869316
What exactly is wrong with any of this?

61869336
>>61869316
>im smarter than ai
you barely even understand what it is.
you think you're smarter than it because chatgpt hallucinated to you once but this is like how reddit midwits think atheism is real and true even though it's self-evidently bullshit

61869344
>>61869324
Because it ultimately ends in a government bailout where ordinary people are robbed and indebted forever to the people who caused it and benefitted from it. I didn't think I had to explain that part. AI is still bullshit, and it's still going to collapse, but not until it's completely exhausted all possible avenues of inflating the bubble. It has to suck up every single dollar in the entire universe, rehypothecate the same dollar 50 times over, until it simply can't go any further, then the government prints 100 sextillion dollars, adds it to the national debt, and imposes harsh austerity and taxation on ordinary people to finance it, combined with massive currency devaluation, and people lose their savings.

Latest replies (last 30, oldest → newest)

61869346
>>61869336
Belief AI can be intelligent and conscious, is the atheist tendency. Your logic is all backwards, because naturally, you are a retard.

61869348
>>61869346
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y4yBvvGi_2A

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NUeybwTMeWo

This is really the bull case cry for stacking firearms and putting aside enough to buy sell swords. While stackers are a smaller population most holdings require, or rather will at such time require, going door to door to seize assets in a country in which one can put together an AR for $350-$400 and drop in FRTs can be had for as little as $100. All this against the population and asset class pairing most likely to own firearms. The logistics don't make sense. You'll see heavy taxes, threats of taxes, capital controls and possibly if briefly bans on sales after a set date. None of this yields as much gold or silver as paying an above market rate. Question is, is there anything worth trading for. If I got a deed to a substantial amount of the land the federal government loves to horde so much I could see myself parting with all (some) of my specie. Nobody can be all stick and no carrot and win. This is why in bank bail ins you atleast get shares in a bank that has recently defaulted.

2006 was giving out loans like candy to people who had absolutely no way of ever servicing them
this then resulted in a lot of forced selling into a no bid market as all of this inventory was cleared when the bubble popped

right now we dont have excessive loans, quite the opposite retards arent given insane loans this is legit existing money bidding up hard assets because so much money got printed and it has to go somewhere
you dont get a crash in housing without forced selling and who is going to force sell his real estate at low prices without the bank margin calling them
unlike stocks which are completely fungible and its price is set at the margin, housing isnt and the owner can just sit on the asset forever and not be forced to take any offer being made at market price

to disrupt this 'bubble' you need the government unprinting the money supply (lol, lmao even) or you need a large section of boomers dying off and leaving their heirs with no way to pay the taxes/upkeep and force dump it
the second one is the only realistic option, tho there is also the risk that the heirs can pay for the inheritance and real estate is now permanently locked up in magnate hands and the nation reduced to permarenting slave
